  • Constructor Details

    • JMailTM

      public JMailTM(String bearerToken, String id)
      Constructs a new JMailTM instance with the specified bearer token and ID.

      This constructor is intended to be initialized by the JMailBuilder class. It sets up the necessary authentication using the provided bearer token and configures a Gson instance with a custom type adapter for handling token-related data.

      Parameters:
      bearerToken - the bearer token used for authentication.
      id - the unique identifier for the JMailTM instance.
      See Also:
      • JMailBuilder

  • Method Details

    • getId

      public String getId()
      Retrieves the id of the user account
      Returns:
      the id of the user

    • init

      public void init()
      Initializes the JMailTM instance by performing necessary setup operations.

      This method fetches and updates the available domains for the instance. It should be called to ensure that the JMailTM instance is properly configured and ready to use. This is only required when using createDefault()

    • getSelf

      public Account getSelf()
      Retrieves the account instance of the logged-in user.
      Returns:
      the account instance of the logged-in user.
      See Also:
      • Account

    • delete

      public boolean delete()
      (Synchronous) Deletes the self account in a synchronous manner.

      This method attempts to delete the account of the logged-in user. It returns true if the account is successfully deleted, otherwise false.

      Returns:
      true if the account is successfully deleted; false otherwise.

    • delete

      public void delete(WorkCallback callback)
      (Synchronous) Deletes the self account and provides a callback with the status of the operation.

      This method attempts to delete the account of the logged-in user and invokes the provided callback with the status of the deletion operation. The callback receives true if the account is successfully deleted, otherwise false.

      Example usage: 

       delete((status) -> {
     if (status) {
         System.out.println("Account deleted successfully.");
     } else {
         System.out.println("Failed to delete account.");
     }
 });

      Parameters:
      callback - the WorkCallback lambda function or an instance created using new WorkCallback().

    • asyncDelete

      public void asyncDelete(WorkCallback callback)
      (Asynchronous) Deletes the self account and provides a callback with the status of the operation.

      This method attempts to delete the account of the logged-in user asynchronously and invokes the provided callback with the status of the deletion operation. The callback receives true if the account is successfully deleted, otherwise false.

      Example usage: 

       asyncDelete((status) -> {
     if (status) {
         System.out.println("Account deleted successfully.");
     } else {
         System.out.println("Failed to delete account.");
     }
 });

      Parameters:
      callback - the WorkCallback lambda function or an instance created using new WorkCallback().

    • asyncDelete

      public void asyncDelete()
      (Asynchronous) Initiates the deletion of the self account in a separate thread.

      This method starts a new thread to delete the account of the logged-in user asynchronously.

    • getAccountById

      public Account getAccountById(String id) throws AccountNotFoundException
      Retrieves a user account using the specified user ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the user ID of the account to retrieve.
      Returns:
      the Account object associated with the given user ID.
      Throws:
      AccountNotFoundException - if the account with the specified ID is not found or an error occurs during retrieval.
      See Also:
      • Account

    • getTotalMessages

      public int getTotalMessages()
      Retrieves the total number of messages in the user's inbox.
      Returns:
      the total number of messages.

    • getMessageById

      public Message getMessageById(String id) throws MessageFetchException
      Retrieves a single message object using the specified message ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the message ID of the message to retrieve.
      Returns:
      the Message object corresponding to the given message ID.
      Throws:
      MessageFetchException - if the message with the specified ID cannot be fetched due to an error.
      See Also:
      • Message

    • fetchMessages

      public void fetchMessages(MessageFetchedCallback callback) throws MessageFetchException
      (Synchronous) Fetches all messages and invokes a callback with the fetched messages or an error response.

      This method synchronously retrieves all messages from the server using a GET request and invokes the provided MessageFetchedCallback with either a list of fetched messages or an error response. It handles exceptions internally and throws a MessageFetchException if fetching fails for any reason.

      Example usage: 

       fetchMessages(new MessageFetchedCallback() {
     \@Override
     public void onMessagesFetched(List messages) {
         // Process fetched messages
     }

     \@Override
     public void onError(Response errorResponse) {
         // Handle error
     }
 });

      Parameters:
      callback - the MessageFetchedCallback implementation to receive the fetched messages or handle errors.
      Throws:
      MessageFetchException - if there's an error while fetching messages from the server.
      See Also:
      • MessageFetchedCallback
      • MessageFetchException

    • fetchMessages

      public void fetchMessages(int limit, MessageFetchedCallback callback) throws MessageFetchException
      (Synchronous) Fetches the first limit number of messages and invokes a callback with the fetched messages or an error response.

      This method synchronously retrieves the first limit number of messages from the server using a GET request and invokes the provided MessageFetchedCallback with either a list of fetched messages or an error response. It handles exceptions internally and throws a MessageFetchException if fetching fails for any reason.

      Example usage: 

       fetchMessages(10, new MessageFetchedCallback() {
     \@Override
     public void onMessagesFetched(List messages) {
         // Process fetched messages
     }

     \@Override
     public void onError(Response errorResponse) {
         // Handle error
     }
 });

      Parameters:
      limit - the maximum number of messages to fetch from the top of the list.
      callback - the MessageFetchedCallback implementation to receive the fetched messages or handle errors.
      Throws:
      MessageFetchException - if there's an error while fetching messages from the server.
      See Also:
      • MessageFetchedCallback
      • MessageFetchException

    • asyncFetchMessages

      public void asyncFetchMessages(MessageFetchedCallback callback)
      (Asynchronous) Initiates the fetching of all messages and invokes a callback with the fetched messages or an error response.

      This method asynchronously initiates the fetching of all messages from the server using a separate thread. It invokes the provided MessageFetchedCallback with either a list of fetched messages or an error response once the messages are retrieved. If there's an error during the fetch process, it handles it internally and invokes the callback's onError method.

      Example usage: 

       asyncFetchMessages(new MessageFetchedCallback() {
     \@Override
     public void onMessagesFetched(List messages) {
         // Process fetched messages
     }

     \@Override
     public void onError(Response errorResponse) {
         // Handle error
     }
 });

      Parameters:
      callback - the MessageFetchedCallback implementation to receive the fetched messages or handle errors.
      See Also:
      • MessageFetchedCallback

    • asyncFetchMessages

      public void asyncFetchMessages(int limit, MessageFetchedCallback callback)
      (Asynchronous) Initiates the fetching of the first limit number of messages and invokes a callback with the fetched messages or an error response.

      This method asynchronously initiates the fetching of the first limit number of messages from the server using a separate thread. It invokes the provided MessageFetchedCallback with either a list of fetched messages or an error response once the messages are retrieved. If there's an error during the fetch process, it handles it internally and invokes the callback's onError method.

      Example usage: 

       asyncFetchMessages(10, new MessageFetchedCallback() {
     \@Override
     public void onMessagesFetched(List messages) {
         // Process fetched messages
     }

     \@Override
     public void onError(Response errorResponse) {
         // Handle error
     }
 });

      Parameters:
      limit - the maximum number of messages to fetch from the top of the list.
      callback - the MessageFetchedCallback implementation to receive the fetched messages or handle errors.
      See Also:
      • MessageFetchedCallback

    • openEventListener

      public void openEventListener(EventListener eventListener, long retryInterval)
      (Asynchronous) Opens an event listener on a single thread to receive server-sent events (SSE).

      This method asynchronously opens an event listener using SSE (Server-Sent Events) on a single thread. It initializes an EventSource with the provided EventListener implementation and connects to the specified MERCURE_URL topic associated with the user account. It handles reconnecting to the server in case of disconnection with the specified retryInterval.

      Example usage: 

       openEventListener(new EventListener() {

     \@Override
     public void onReady() {
         // Handle error
     }
 }, 5000); // Retry every 5 seconds if disconnected

      Parameters:
      eventListener - the EventListener implementation to handle incoming events and errors.
      retryInterval - the reconnect timeout interval in milliseconds if the server disconnects unexpectedly.

    • openEventListener

      public void openEventListener(EventListener eventListener)
      (Asynchronous) Open's a default event listener on a single thread
      Parameters:
      eventListener - EventListener implemented class

    • closeMessageListener

      public void closeMessageListener()
      Closes the message listener, shutting down the thread pool used for event handling.

      This method shuts down the thread pool used for handling events, effectively stopping any ongoing event processing or listeners initiated by this instance.

    • openMessageListener

      @Deprecated public void openMessageListener(MessageListener messageListener, long retryInterval)
      Deprecated.
      (Asynchronous) Opens a Message Listener on a New Thread
      Parameters:
      messageListener - MessageListener Implemented Class
      retryInterval - The Refresh Time for Fetching Messages

    • openMessageListener

      (Asynchronous) Opens a MessageListener on a New Thread Default Refresh Time 1.5 seconds
      Parameters:
